'''Polyculturalism''' is a concept which asserts that all of the world's [[culture|cultures]] are inter-related. It is thus opposed to the concept of [[multiculturalism]], which its supporters argue is divisive. Polyculturalism was the subject of the [[2001]] book ''Everybody Was Kung Fu Fighting: Afro-Asian Connections and the Myth of Cultural Purity'' by [[Vijay Prashad]].
